channel.title: Comments on: Rabbi Shmuly Yanklowitz on avoiding harm
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: AS
item.dc:creator: AS
item.description:
It's not really surprising that metaethics is being ignored. First, modern metaethics has insisted by and large that it is neutral regarding normative ethics. Second, as it has become increasingly technical in its analytic varieties, with a lot of filling in the gaps between stark raving realism and stark raving skepticism.
I actually wish that given the title and topic Rabbi Yanklowitz had focused a bit more on Jewish law. Instead he makes a move from strict legal liability to a broad consequentialist view of moral responsibility.
